intro: Axanthes macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf axanthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. It is known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and modest blooms. Axanthes macrophylla is generally hardy and can thrive in moderate climates with proper care.
